body:
There's an extension that handles SNI:
https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/tree/alpha/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/sniTerminator

On https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/releases see sniTerminator-alpha-3.zap

Also: https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/wiki/HelpAddonsSniTerminatorSniTerminator

Closing.
Right, but this can (and should) be supported by the local proxy (it avoids having a second proxy).
Setting for 2.7.0, easier to add to local proxy now that core is targeting Java 8.

issue.title: Add SNI support to Local Proxy

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change SSLConnector to rely on SNI if the domain is not known when
creating the SSL/TLS tunnel.
Change ProxyThread to check if the first message received is a SSL/TLS
handshake and start the SSL/TLS connection if so, also, tweak an
exception message to differentiate the case where the domain is unknown
(relying on SNI) from when it's known.

Fix #1015 - Support Server Name Indication

issue.title: Document SNI capability in Local Proxies

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Change Options Local Proxies screen page to document that the local
proxies can be used as intercepting proxies, for HTTPS using SNI.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#1015 - Support Server Name Indication

---
Based on https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/wiki/HelpAddonsSniTerminatorSniTerminator
